details.issue_type: Incorrect parameter constraints and required flag
details.documented_behavior: | quantity | number | no | Number of items (0–10) |
details.actual_behavior: `quantity` is required (present on the input type) and the implementation throws an error when quantity < 1 or quantity > 5

citations.doc: README_backup.md — table row: `| quantity | number | no | Number of items (0–10) |`
citations.code: api.ts — CreateOrderInput (lines 3-7) and validation/throw in createOrder (lines 20-23)

details.fix_summary: Mark `quantity` as required and document the allowed range (1–5) and the thrown error when out of range.

details.documented_behavior: | couponCode | string | yes | Discount coupon code |
details.actual_behavior: `couponCode` is optional on the input type (`couponCode?: string`) and the implementation does not require it.

citations.doc: README_backup.md — table row: `| couponCode | string | yes | Discount coupon code |`

details.fix_summary: Mark `couponCode` as optional in the documentation.

details.actual_behavior: Returns `{ orderId: string; totalPrice: number }` — the function always returns `orderId` and `totalPrice` (no `success` field).

citations.code: api.ts — OrderResult (lines 9-12) and return statement in createOrder (lines 25-28)

details.fix_summary: Update the documented return type to `{ orderId: string; totalPrice: number }` and describe `totalPrice` calculation.

details.documented_behavior: No validation errors or exceptions are documented for invalid `quantity`.
details.actual_behavior: The implementation throws `new Error("Invalid quantity")` when quantity is outside 1–5.

citations.doc: section; parameters and returns do not mention thrown errors)
citations.code: api.ts — validation and throw in createOrder (lines 20-23)

details.fix_summary: Add an Errors section describing the thrown `Error("Invalid quantity")` when `quantity` is <1 or >5.

details.documented_behavior: The original docs do not describe how `orderId` and price are produced.
details.actual_behavior: Implementation returns a fixed `orderId` of `"ORD-001"` and computes `totalPrice` as `quantity * 100`.
details.fix_summary: Document that `orderId` is currently the fixed string `"ORD-001"` and that `totalPrice` is `quantity * 100`.
